alert.note: Alert for Independence; Lawrence; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 2:02PM CDT until April 13 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Lawrence County in eastern Arkansas... North Central Independence County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Sharp County in north central Arkansas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 202 PM CDT, Local Broadcast media reported flooding in Cave City with some water coming into the local high school due to thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall in the area. US 167 and Woodland Dr in Cave City was also reported flooded. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 inches in 1 hour and 30 minutes. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cave City, Ravenden, Strawberry, Annieville, Smithville, Williford, Aetna, Nelsonville, Poughkeepsie, Calamine, Sitka, Maxville, Ozark Acres and Sandtown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR AND 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
